|--------|-----------------|---------------------|----------------|
| **Performance decline** | Â±2â€“3% day-to-day | >5% decline sustained over 2+ weeks despite adequate recovery | Flag for review |
| **Resting heart rate** | Â±3 bpm day-to-day | â‰¥5 bpm above rolling 7-day average for 3+ consecutive days (Kreher & Schwartz, 2012; TrainingPeaks) | Reduce intensity; monitor for illness |
| **HRV depression** | Â±5â€“10% day-to-day | >1 standard deviation below 7-day rolling mean for 3â€“4 consecutive days (Human Performance Alliance, 2024) | Insert recovery day; reduce volume 30% |
| **Sleep disruption** | Occasional poor night | <6 hrs for 3+ consecutive nights, OR sleep efficiency <75% for 1+ week | Mandatory light day; investigate cause |
| **Mood/motivation changes** | Normal fluctuation | Profile of Mood States (POMS) vigor score decline >15% or persistent negative mood for 5+ days | Conversation prompt; reduce training load |
| **Persistent soreness** | 24â€“48 hr DOMS normal | Muscle soreness â‰¥4/10 persisting >72 hours after a familiar workout | Skip strength session; active recovery only |
| **Training session completion** | Can start AND finish | Ability to start but inability to complete planned sessions (classic OTS sign; Budgett, 1998) | Immediate red flag; insert 3+ rest days |

#### Decision Framework: Push Through vs. Back Off

**PUSH THROUGH fatigue when:**
- HRV is within normal range (within 1 SD of rolling mean)
- Resting HR is within 3 bpm of baseline
- Athlete reports 6/10 or better motivation/mood
- Soreness is â‰¤3/10 and localized (not systemic)
- Sleep was â‰¥7 hours with normal quality
- Performance in warm-up sets is within 5% of expected

**BACK OFF when any 2+ of these are true:**
- HRV depressed >1 SD below baseline for 2+ days
- Resting HR elevated â‰¥5 bpm for 2+ days
- Mood/motivation â‰¤4/10
- Soreness is systemic (whole body) and >72 hours post-training
- Sleep was <6 hours or severely disrupted
- Performance in warm-up sets is >5% below expected

**MANDATORY REST when any 1 of these is true:**
- Signs of illness (sore throat, fever, swollen glands)
- Resting HR elevated â‰¥8 bpm above baseline
- Unable to complete warm-up at expected intensity
- 3+ warning signs present simultaneously for 3+ consecutive days

#### Reactive Deload Protocol

Unlike planned deloads (every 3â€“4 weeks), reactive deloads are triggered by the warning signs above. The AI coach should implement the following:

**Phase 1 â€” Acute Response (Days 1â€“3):**
- Reduce training volume by 50%
- Eliminate all high-intensity work (no intervals, no heavy lifting)
- Replace planned sessions with Zone 1 movement only (30â€“40 min walk, easy bike)
- Prioritize 9+ hours of sleep opportunity
- Increase carbohydrate intake by 1 g/kg/day

section: 1. Recovery & Adaptation Science for Hybrid Athletes > 1.4 Overtraining & Overreaching (part 2/2)
content:
**Phase 2 â€” Assessment (Days 4â€“5):**
- Retest: Check morning HRV, RHR, sleep quality, subjective mood
- If markers improving â†’ transition to Phase 3
- If markers unchanged or worsening â†’ extend Phase 1 for 3 more days and screen for illness/life stressors

**Phase 3 â€” Gradual Return (Days 6â€“10):**
- Day 6â€“7: 70% of normal volume, low-to-moderate intensity only
- Day 8â€“10: 85% of normal volume, reintroduce moderate intensity
- Day 11+: Return to full programming if all markers are normalized

**Critical rule**: The athlete must demonstrate 2 consecutive days of normalized HRV and RHR before returning to high-intensity training.

---

section: 1. Recovery & Adaptation Science for Hybrid Athletes > 1.5 Nutrition for Training (part 1/2)
content:
#### Daily Caloric Needs

A hybrid athlete running ~35â€“40 miles per week (56â€“64 km) plus 4â€“5 strength sessions requires substantial caloric intake. Using established estimates:

- **Running**: ~80â€“100 kcal/mile Ã— 35â€“40 mpw = 2,800â€“4,000 kcal/week from running
- **Strength**: ~250â€“400 kcal/session Ã— 4â€“5 = 1,000â€“2,000 kcal/week from lifting
- **BMR + NEAT**: ~1,800â€“2,200 kcal/day for a 70â€“85 kg male athlete

**Estimated total**: **2,800â€“3,800 kcal/day** for a male Hyrox athlete (70â€“85 kg). Female athletes (55â€“70 kg): **2,200â€“3,000 kcal/day**. These ranges depend on body size, training phase, and metabolic rate. Chronic underfueling leads to Relative Energy Deficiency in Sport (RED-S) (Mountjoy et al., 2018 IOC Consensus).

#### Macronutrient Targets

| Macronutrient | Target | Evidence Base |
|---------------|--------|---------------|
| **Protein** | **1.6â€“2.2 g/kg/day** | ISSN position stand (JÃ¤ger et al., 2017): 1.4â€“2.0 g/kg/day for exercising individuals. Concurrent training athletes (combined endurance + resistance) should target the *upper end* of this range (1.6â€“2.2 g/kg) due to increased amino acid oxidation from endurance work (PMC, 2025: 0.4â€“0.5 g/kg per meal for endurance-adapted athletes). Distribute across **4â€“5 meals** at 0.3â€“0.5 g/kg per meal (20â€“40 g per serving). |
| **Carbohydrates** | **5â€“8 g/kg/day** (training days); **3â€“5 g/kg/day** (rest days) | ACSM/AND/DC joint position (2016): 5â€“7 g/kg for 1 hr/day moderate exercise, 6â€“10 g/kg for 1â€“3 hr/day moderate-to-high. A Hyrox athlete training 1.5â€“2.5 hr/day should target 5â€“8 g/kg on training days. Lower on rest days to support recovery without excess. |
| **Fat** | **Minimum 0.8 g/kg/day**; optimal **1.0â€“1.5 g/kg/day** (20â€“35% of total calories) | Fat is essential for hormone synthesis (testosterone, estrogen), fat-soluble vitamin absorption (D, E, K, A), and cell membrane integrity. Below 0.8 g/kg, hormonal dysfunction risk increases. No performance benefit from going above 35% of calories. |

#### Pre-Workout Nutrition

| Scenario | Timing | Composition |
|----------|--------|-------------|
| **AM session (fasted risk)** | 60â€“90 min before: full meal OR 30â€“45 min before: light snack | Full meal: 1â€“2 g/kg carbs + 0.3 g/kg protein + low fat. Snack: banana + small protein shake, rice cake + honey + nut butter. |
| **PM session (fed state)** | 2â€“3 hours before: regular meal OR 60 min before: snack | If last meal was 3+ hours ago, have a snack with 30â€“50g carbs and 15â€“20g protein. If meal was within 2 hours, no additional food needed. |
| **Two-a-day sessions** | Between sessions: prioritize carb repletion | 1.0â€“1.2 g/kg carbs within 30 min of first session ending (Beelen et al., 2010). Add 20â€“25g protein. |

#### Post-Workout Nutrition: Evidence vs. Myth

**The "30-minute anabolic window" is largely a myth** â€” at least for athletes training in a fed state (Aragon & Schoenfeld, 2013; Schoenfeld et al., 2013):

- **Fed state training**: If the athlete consumed a meal within 3â€“4 hours before exercise, amino acids and insulin are still elevated. The "window" effectively extends to 5â€“6 hours surrounding training. Total daily protein intake matters far more than precise post-workout timing (Schoenfeld et al., 2013).
- **Fasted state training**: If training occurs after an overnight fast (early AM), post-workout protein becomes more time-sensitive. Consume 20â€“40g protein within 1â€“2 hours.
- **For glycogen repletion**: If the athlete has another session within 8 hours, carbohydrate timing IS important â€” consume 1.0â€“1.2 g/kg carbs as soon as practical post-exercise (Beelen et al., 2010). If the next session is 24+ hours away, timing is less critical; total daily intake matters more.

**Practical recommendation**: Consume a mixed meal of protein (30â€“40g) and carbohydrates (0.8â€“1.2 g/kg) within 2 hours of training. Don't stress if it's 30 minutes vs. 90 minutes â€” the difference is negligible for most fed-state athletes.

#### Hydration

section: 1. Recovery & Adaptation Science for Hybrid Athletes > 1.5 Nutrition for Training (part 2/2)
content:
#### Hydration

- **Daily fluid target**: Minimum 35â€“45 mL/kg bodyweight (~2.5â€“3.5 L for a 75 kg athlete) PLUS replacement of exercise-induced losses.
- **Sweat rate estimation**: Weigh before and after 1 hour of training (minimally clothed, toweled dry). Each kg lost â‰ˆ 1L of sweat. Typical range: 0.5â€“2.5 L/hour.
- **Electrolyte needs**: Sodium is the primary electrolyte lost in sweat (300â€“1,200 mg/L). Athletes training >90 min or heavy sweaters should add 500â€“1,000 mg sodium per hour of training (sports drink, electrolyte tabs, or salted food).
- **Urine color**: Pale straw = adequate. Dark gold = dehydrated. Clear = likely overhydrated (flushing electrolytes).

#### Supplements With Actual Evidence

| Supplement | Evidence Level | Dose | Mechanism | Hyrox Relevance |
|-----------|---------------|------|-----------|-----------------|
| **Creatine monohydrate** | â­â­â­â­â­ (A-level) | 3â€“5 g/day (no loading needed) | Replenishes phosphocreatine for short-burst power; may improve glycogen repletion; supports lean mass. ISSN position stand confirms safety and efficacy (Buford et al., 2007). | High: Sled push, sled pull, farmers carry, wall balls â€” all benefit from repeated high-force contractions. |
| **Caffeine** | â­â­â­â­â­ (A-level) | 3â€“6 mg/kg, 30â€“60 min pre-exercise | Adenosine receptor antagonist; reduces perceived exertion, improves endurance and strength-endurance. | High: Race day and key training sessions. Monitor sleep impact â€” stop use by early afternoon. |
| **Beta-alanine** | â­â­â­â­ (A-level) | 3.2â€“6.4 g/day (split doses to avoid paresthesia) | Increases intramuscular carnosine, buffering Hâº ions during high-intensity work (60â€“240 sec efforts). Hoffman et al. (2006): Co-supplementation with creatine improved repeated sprint performance. | Moderate-High: Wall balls (5â€“7 min sustained), SkiErg (3â€“4 min), Rowing (4â€“5 min) â€” all in the sweet spot of beta-alanine's buffering capacity. |
| **Vitamin D** | â­â­â­â­ (if deficient) | 1,000â€“4,000 IU/day (test serum 25(OH)D; target >40 ng/mL) | Supports bone health, immune function, muscle function, mood. Deficiency is common (40â€“75% of athletes; Larson-Meyer & Willis, 2010). | Moderate: Foundational health. Deficiency impairs recovery and increases injury risk. |
| **Omega-3 (EPA/DHA)** | â­â­â­ (B-level) | 2â€“3 g combined EPA+DHA daily | Anti-inflammatory; may reduce DOMS severity and improve muscle recovery (Jouris et al., 2011). Supports cardiovascular health. | Moderate: Recovery support for high training volumes. |
| **Electrolytes (sodium, potassium, magnesium)** | â­â­â­â­ (practical) | As needed based on sweat losses | Maintain fluid balance, nerve/muscle function | High: Essential for training >60 min, especially in warm indoor Hyrox venues. |

---

section: 2. Testing & Benchmarking Protocols > 2.1 Baseline Testing Battery (Week 0) (part 1/2)
content:
Administer over 3â€“4 days to allow adequate recovery between tests. Testing order matters â€” do not combine maximal aerobic and maximal strength tests on the same day.

#### Day 1: Body Composition + Aerobic Capacity

**Body Composition (5 min)**
- Body weight (fasted, morning, after voiding)
- Waist circumference (at navel, relaxed exhale)
- Estimated body fat: Use Navy method (neck + waist circumference for men; neck + waist + hip for women) or skinfold calipers (3-site). Track trends, not absolute values.

**Cooper 12-Minute Run Test (30 min including warm-up)**
- **Warm-up**: 10 min easy jog + dynamic stretches + 2 Ã— 30-sec strides
- **Protocol**: Run as far as possible in exactly 12 minutes on a flat track (400m preferred) or flat treadmill
- **Scoring**: Record total distance in meters
- **VOâ‚‚max estimation**: VOâ‚‚max = (22.351 Ã— distance in km) âˆ’ 11.288 (Cooper, 1968; correlation r = 0.90 with lab VOâ‚‚max testing)
- **Cool-down**: 5 min easy walk

| Distance (m) | Estimated VOâ‚‚max (mL/kg/min) | Hyrox Relevance |
|--------------|------------------------------|-----------------|
| 2,000 | 33.4 | Beginner â€” significant aerobic work needed |
| 2,400 | 42.4 | Intermediate â€” solid aerobic base |
| 2,800 | 51.3 | Advanced â€” strong aerobic capacity |
| 3,000+ | 55.8+ | Elite â€” competitive aerobic fitness |

#### Day 2: Lactate Threshold Proxy + Running Economy

**30-Minute Time Trial (45 min total)**
- **Warm-up**: 10 min easy jog + 4 Ã— 30-sec progressive strides
- **Protocol**: Run at the fastest pace sustainable for exactly 30 minutes (flat course or treadmill at 1% incline). This approximates functional threshold pace (Inglis et al., 2020).
- **Record**: Total distance AND average pace. Average heart rate during final 20 minutes = estimated lactate threshold heart rate (LTHR).
- **Cool-down**: 5 min easy jog

**Running Economy Assessment (integrated)**
- During warm-up, note pace at conversational effort (can speak in full sentences = Zone 2 / aerobic base pace).
- Record this pace â€” it serves as the reference for all easy running prescriptions.

#### Day 3: Strength Baselines

**Estimated 1RM Testing (60 min total)**

Use a 3RM or 5RM test and calculate estimated 1RM. Safer and more practical than true 1RM testing for non-competitive lifters.

| Lift | Protocol | 1RM Estimation |
|------|----------|----------------|
| **Back Squat** | Warm-up: empty bar Ã— 10, 50% Ã— 5, 70% Ã— 3, 85% Ã— 1. Then: find heaviest set of 3 (3RM). | 1RM â‰ˆ 3RM Ã— 1.08 (Brzycki formula) |
| **Deadlift** | Same warm-up progression. Find 3RM. | 1RM â‰ˆ 3RM Ã— 1.08 |
| **Strict Press** | Warm-up: empty bar Ã— 10, 50% Ã— 5, 70% Ã— 3. Find 5RM. | 1RM â‰ˆ 5RM Ã— 1.15 |

- Rest 3â€“5 min between max-effort attempts
- Record load AND bodyweight for strength-to-bodyweight ratio calculation

#### Day 4: Station-Specific Time Trials

Perform each station individually with full recovery. **Rest 5â€“8 minutes between stations** to capture true station capacity, not fatigue carryover.

section: 2. Testing & Benchmarking Protocols > 2.1 Baseline Testing Battery (Week 0) (part 2/2) + 2. Testing & Benchmarking Protocols > 2.2 Monthly Check-In Tests
content:
Perform each station individually with full recovery. **Rest 5â€“8 minutes between stations** to capture true station capacity, not fatigue carryover.

| Station | Protocol | Record |
|---------|----------|--------|
| **SkiErg 1,000m** | All-out effort for 1,000m | Time (mm:ss) + avg pace/500m |
| **Sled Push 50m** | Race weight (152 kg men / 102 kg women); complete 50m as fast as possible | Time (mm:ss) |
| **Sled Pull 50m** | Race weight (103 kg men / 78 kg women); seated rope pull | Time (mm:ss) |
| **Burpee Broad Jumps 80m** | Full 80m as fast as possible | Time (mm:ss) |
| **Row 1,000m** | All-out effort for 1,000m | Time (mm:ss) + avg pace/500m |
| **Farmers Carry 200m** | Race weight (2 Ã— 24 kg men / 2 Ã— 16 kg women); complete 200m | Time (mm:ss) + number of drops |
| **Sandbag Lunges 100m** | Race weight (20 kg men / 10 kg women); complete 100m | Time (mm:ss) |
| **Wall Balls 100 reps** | Race weight (6 kg men / 4 kg women to 3m/2.7m target); 100 unbroken or with breaks | Time (mm:ss) + break pattern |

**Note**: Station testing in isolation is faster than race performance because there is no accumulated fatigue. Race-day station times are typically 15â€“30% slower than fresh testing.

---

Not every test needs to be repeated monthly. Frequency depends on sensitivity to change and athlete fatigue cost.

| Test | Frequency | Rationale |
|------|-----------|-----------|
| **Cooper test** (or 2K time trial) | Every 4â€“6 weeks | VOâ‚‚max changes slowly; monthly testing captures meaningful trends |
| **30-min time trial** | Every 6â€“8 weeks | Threshold fitness changes slowly; over-testing adds unnecessary fatigue |
| **Body composition** (weight, waist) | Every 2â€“4 weeks | Weight weekly (rolling 7-day average); waist monthly |
| **Strength 3RM tests** | Every 6â€“8 weeks | Strength gains in trained athletes are slow; frequent maximal testing adds injury risk |
| **Station time trials (2 stations)** | Every 4 weeks â€” rotate which 2 stations | Test the 2 weakest stations each month; cycle through all 8 over 4 months |
| **Resting HR / HRV** | Daily (passive monitoring) | Trend data; not a formal "test" but the most valuable ongoing metric |
| **Running economy (Zone 2 pace at same HR)** | Every 4 weeks | Track cardiac drift: same HR should produce faster pace as fitness improves |

#### Interpreting Month-over-Month Changes

| Metric | Meaningful Improvement | Noise / Normal Variation |
|--------|----------------------|--------------------------|
| Cooper test distance | â‰¥100m improvement | Â±50m (weather, motivation, fatigue) |
| 30-min TT distance | â‰¥200m or â‰¥5 sec/km pace improvement | Â±100m |
| Back squat 3RM | â‰¥5% increase | Â±2.5% (daily readiness variation) |
| SkiErg 1,000m | â‰¥5 sec improvement | Â±3 sec |
| Wall Balls 100 reps | â‰¥15 sec improvement | Â±8 sec |
| Sled push 50m | â‰¥10 sec improvement | Â±5 sec (sled surface friction varies) |
| Zone 2 pace at same HR | â‰¥5 sec/km faster | Â±3 sec/km (temperature, hydration) |

**Principle**: Require â‰¥2 consecutive tests showing improvement in the same direction before concluding a real training effect. Single data points are unreliable.

---

section: 2. Testing & Benchmarking Protocols > 2.3 Performance Predictors & Targets
content:
#### VOâ‚‚max Targets by Hyrox Performance Tier

| Hyrox Finish (Men) | Estimated VOâ‚‚max Required | Cooper Test Distance | 5K Proxy |
|--------------------|---------------------------|---------------------|----------|
| Sub-60 min (Pro elite) | â‰¥60 mL/kg/min | â‰¥3,200m | <17:00 |
| 60â€“75 min (Elite/Advanced) | 50â€“60 mL/kg/min | 2,750â€“3,200m | 17:00â€“20:00 |
| 75â€“90 min (Intermediate) | 42â€“50 mL/kg/min | 2,400â€“2,750m | 20:00â€“24:00 |
| 90+ min (Beginner) | <42 mL/kg/min | <2,400m | >24:00 |

*Women: Adjust VOâ‚‚max thresholds down ~5 mL/kg/min, running paces ~10â€“15% slower.*

#### Strength-to-Bodyweight Ratios Correlated with Hyrox Performance

| Lift | Beginner (<90 min) | Intermediate (75â€“90) | Advanced (60â€“75) | Elite (<60) |
|------|--------------------|-----------------------|-------------------|-------------|
| Back Squat 1RM/BW | 0.8â€“1.0Ã— | 1.0â€“1.3Ã— | 1.3â€“1.6Ã— | 1.6â€“2.0Ã— |
| Deadlift 1RM/BW | 1.0â€“1.3Ã— | 1.3â€“1.6Ã— | 1.6â€“2.0Ã— | 2.0â€“2.5Ã— |
| Strict Press 1RM/BW | 0.4â€“0.5Ã— | 0.5â€“0.65Ã— | 0.65â€“0.8Ã— | 0.8â€“1.0Ã— |

**Rationale**: Sled push (152 kg) requires substantial lower body strength. An 80 kg male pushing 152 kg is pushing ~1.9Ã— BW. A higher squat-to-BW ratio directly predicts sled push speed. Similarly, deadlift strength correlates with sled pull performance, and press strength supports wall ball and SkiErg overhead drive.

#### Running Pace Benchmarks Predicting Hyrox Performance

| 5K Time | 10K Time | Predicted Hyrox Running Split (8 km) | Hyrox Tier |
|---------|----------|--------------------------------------|------------|
| <17:00 | <35:00 | 32â€“36 min | Elite |
| 17:00â€“20:00 | 35:00â€“42:00 | 36â€“44 min | Advanced |
| 20:00â€“24:00 | 42:00â€“50:00 | 44â€“54 min | Intermediate |
| >24:00 | >50:00 | >54 min | Beginner |

**Note**: Hyrox running splits include RoxZone transitions and the metabolic cost of station-to-run transitions. Expect Hyrox km pace to be 20â€“40 sec/km slower than standalone 10K pace.

#### Station-Specific Benchmarks Indicating Race Readiness

Based on data from Hyrox Data Lab (700,000+ race results) and ChAIron training guides:

| Station | Beginner Target | Intermediate Target | Advanced Target | Elite Target |
|---------|----------------|---------------------|-----------------|-------------|
| SkiErg 1000m | 5:00â€“6:00 | 4:00â€“5:00 | 3:00â€“3:30 | <3:00 |
| Sled Push 50m | 4:00â€“5:00 | 3:00â€“3:30 | 2:30â€“3:00 | <2:30 |
| Sled Pull 50m | 3:30â€“4:30 | 2:30â€“3:15 | 2:00â€“2:30 | <2:00 |
| Burpee Broad Jump 80m | 7:00â€“8:30 | 6:00â€“7:00 | 5:00â€“6:00 | <5:00 |
| Row 1000m | 5:00â€“5:30 | 4:00â€“4:45 | 3:30â€“4:00 | <3:30 |
| Farmers Carry 200m | 2:30â€“3:30 | 2:00â€“2:30 | 1:45â€“2:00 | <1:45 |
| Lunges 100m | 5:30â€“7:00 | 4:30â€“5:30 | 3:45â€“4:30 | <3:45 |
| Wall Balls 100 reps | 6:00â€“7:00 | 4:00â€“5:00 | 3:30â€“4:00 | <3:30 |

*Times are isolated (fresh) station times. Add 15â€“30% for race-day estimates under fatigue.*

---

section: 2. Testing & Benchmarking Protocols > 2.4 Decision Points: AI Coach Decision Rules (part 1/2)
content:
These if/then rules enable automated coaching adjustments based on test results and ongoing monitoring data.

---

**Rule 1: Aerobic Gains, Station Stagnation**
> **IF** Cooper test improves by â‰¥150m over 8 weeks **BUT** station times (sled push, wall balls, farmers carry) stagnate or worsen â†’
> **THEN** Shift 2 weekly training sessions from pure running to concurrent training: station-specific strength-endurance circuits (e.g., sled push + wall balls + farmers carry at race weight, 3â€“4 rounds, with 1km run between rounds). Aerobic base is sufficient; the limiter is now muscular endurance under fatigue.

---

**Rule 2: Strength Up, Run Pace Down**
> **IF** squat and deadlift 3RM improve by â‰¥8% over 8 weeks **BUT** 30-min time trial pace slows by â‰¥5 sec/km â†’
> **THEN** Likely concurrent training interference. Reduce strength training frequency from 4â€“5 to 3 sessions/week. Separate running and strength sessions by â‰¥6 hours. Ensure carbohydrate intake on training days is â‰¥6 g/kg. Move heavy strength to AM; run sessions to PM (or vice versa). Prioritize running volume in the current mesocycle.

---

**Rule 3: Performance Plateau (3+ Weeks)**
> **IF** athlete shows <1% improvement in any primary metric (Cooper test, 30-min TT, or 2+ station times) for 3+ consecutive weeks despite consistent training â†’
> **THEN** Implement a structured stimulus change block (2 weeks): (a) Swap training modalities (replace steady runs with fartlek; replace standard strength with unilateral/tempo work). (b) Introduce a novel stressor (hill sprints, altitude mask, sled sprint intervals). (c) If HRV/RHR show no suppression â†’ the athlete is *undertrained*, not overtrained â€” increase training intensity by 10% for the next mesocycle.

---

**Rule 4: HRV Crash Protocol**
> **IF** HRV drops >1.5 SD below the 14-day rolling mean for 3+ consecutive days AND resting HR is elevated â‰¥5 bpm â†’
> **THEN** Activate Reactive Deload Protocol (Section 1.4). Cancel all high-intensity sessions. Replace with Zone 1 only. Add 1 extra rest day. Increase sleep target to 9+ hours. Retest HRV daily. Do not return to normal programming until HRV returns to within 0.5 SD of baseline for 2 consecutive days.

---

**Rule 5: Running Improves, SkiErg/Row Stagnate**
> **IF** 30-min TT improves by â‰¥200m **BUT** SkiErg and/or Row 1000m times do not improve â†’
> **THEN** The limiter is upper body pulling endurance, not aerobic capacity. Add 2Ã— weekly SkiErg/Row interval sessions: 6 Ã— 250m at goal race pace with 90 sec rest; OR 4 Ã— 500m at threshold pace with 2 min rest. Add supplementary lat, tricep, and posterior chain work (lat pulldowns, tricep dips, prone rows).

---

**Rule 6: Single-Station Bottleneck**
> **IF** one station time is >25% slower than the athlete's percentile rank in all other stations â†’
> **THEN** Designate that station as the "limiter station." Allocate 3 specific sessions/week to that station for 4 weeks. Approach: 1 technique session (low weight, perfect form, video analysis), 1 capacity session (race weight, pacing practice), 1 endurance session (above race weight or extended reps/distance). Retest after 4 weeks.

---

**Rule 7: Weight Loss + Performance Decline**
> **IF** bodyweight drops >2% in 2 weeks AND performance metrics decline (any test) AND athlete is not intentionally cutting â†’
> **THEN** Flag RED-S risk (Relative Energy Deficiency in Sport). Immediately increase caloric intake by 300â€“500 kcal/day with emphasis on carbohydrates. Reduce training volume by 20%. Screen for disordered eating patterns (refer to sport dietitian if available). Do not increase training volume until weight stabilizes.

---

section: 2. Testing & Benchmarking Protocols > 2.4 Decision Points: AI Coach Decision Rules (part 2/2)
content:
---

**Rule 8: Grip Failure Pattern**
> **IF** Farmers Carry time includes >2 drops AND/OR Sled Pull time is >30% slower than Sled Push (relative to benchmarks) â†’
> **THEN** Grip strength is the limiter. Prescribe: (a) Farmers carry holds 3Ã—/week: 3 Ã— 45 sec at race weight, building to 3 Ã— 75 sec. (b) Towel hangs or fat grip work 2Ã—/week. (c) Forearm roller or rice bucket work daily. (d) Rope climbing or rope pull variations 1â€“2Ã—/week.

---

**Rule 9: Sled Push Catastrophe Signal**
> **IF** Sled Push time is >2Ã— the athlete's row time (e.g., Row 4:30 but Sled Push 9:00+) â†’
> **THEN** Lower body strength is critically insufficient. Reprioritize programming: increase squat and leg press volume by 30%, add heavy prowler/sled sessions 2Ã—/week at sub-race weight building to race weight. Temporarily reduce running volume by 15% to accommodate. Retest sled push every 3 weeks until it falls below 1.5Ã— row time.

---

**Rule 10: Positive Adaptation Confirmation**
> **IF** Cooper test improves â‰¥100m AND 30-min TT improves â‰¥200m AND â‰¥4 of 8 station times improve â‰¥5% AND bodyweight is stable (Â±1 kg) AND HRV is trending upward over 4-week block â†’
> **THEN** Training plan is working. Maintain current programming structure for 1 more mesocycle (3â€“4 weeks) before introducing the next progressive overload phase. Document the winning recipe (session split, volume, intensity distribution) as this athlete's "known good" template for future reference.

---

**Rule 11: Race Simulation Readiness Check**
> **IF** athlete is â‰¤4 weeks from race day AND has not completed a full race simulation (8 stations + 8km running in sequence) â†’
> **THEN** Schedule a full or partial simulation (minimum: 4 stations + 4km) within the next 10 days. Use race weights. Record all split times. This is the single most valuable session in the final training block â€” it calibrates pacing, identifies nutrition needs, and builds psychological confidence. Taper begins after this session.

---

**Rule 12: Sleep Crisis Override**
> **IF** athlete reports <6 hours sleep for 3+ consecutive nights (regardless of all other metrics) â†’
> **THEN** Override all training prescriptions. Replace any planned high-intensity or heavy strength session with Zone 1 active recovery or complete rest. Sleep debt accumulates non-linearly â€” 3 nights of 5.5 hours creates more deficit than one night of 3 hours. Address the root cause (stress, schedule, sleep hygiene) before restoring training load. Growth hormone secretion, glycogen repletion, and motor consolidation are all compromised (Charest & Grandner, 2020; Mougin et al., 2001).

---

section: 1. Macro-Level Periodization Structure > 1.1 Phase Overview + 1. Macro-Level Periodization Structure > 1.2 Deload Weeks
content:
| Phase | Weeks | Dates | Primary Goal | Running Volume | Strength Sessions | HIIT/Hyrox Sessions | Hyrox Simulations |
|-------|-------|-------|-------------|---------------|-------------------|--------------------|--------------------|
| **Phase 1: General Prep** | 1â€“4 | Feb 17 â€“ Mar 16 | Build aerobic engine, introduce Hyrox movements, establish baseline benchmarks | 35â€“38 mpw | 2/week | 2/week | 0 (benchmark testing only) |
| **Phase 2: Specific Prep** | 5â€“8 | Mar 17 â€“ Apr 13 | Develop station-specific capacity, increase HIIT density, introduce compromised running | 36â€“40 mpw | 2/week | 3/week | 1 (half-sim in Week 8) |
| **Phase 3: Competition Prep** | 9â€“12 | Apr 14 â€“ May 11 | Race-pace simulation, pacing discipline, peak HIIT complexity, refine weaknesses | 35â€“38 mpw | 1â€“2/week | 3/week | 2 (Weeks 10, 12) |
| **Phase 4: Taper & Peak** | 13â€“16 | May 12 â€“ Jun 6 | Reduce volume, maintain intensity, sharpen race-day execution, mental prep | 28â€“32 mpw (â†“20â€“25%) | 1/week | 2/week (reduced volume) | 1 (Week 14, dress rehearsal) |

Every 4th week is a **deload week** (Weeks 4, 8, 12). During deload:
- Running volume drops 20â€“25%
- HIIT session count drops from 3 â†’ 2, with reduced volume per session (cut sets by 30â€“40%)
- Strength intensity maintained at 85â€“90% of working loads but volume halved (2 sets instead of 4)
- No race simulations during deload
- Add one extra rest or active recovery day

Week 16 is the final taper/race week â€” treated as a super-deload.

section: 1. Macro-Level Periodization Structure > 1.3 Weekly Volume Progression Table
1. Macro-Level Periodization Structure > 1.4 How Key Variables Evolve Across Phases + 2. Weekly Templates by Phase > 2.1 Phase 1: General Preparation (Weeks 1â€“3; Week 4 = Deload)
content:
| Variable | Phase 1 (GP) | Phase 2 (SP) | Phase 3 (CP) | Phase 4 (Taper) |
|----------|-------------|-------------|-------------|----------------|
| **Running intensity mix** | 80% Zone 2, 10% tempo, 10% intervals | 75% Z2, 10% tempo, 15% intervals + compromised | 70% Z2, 10% tempo, 20% intervals + compromised | 75% Z2, 25% short sharp work |
| **Sled weight** | 80% race weight (122 kg) | 90% race weight (137 kg) | 100% race weight (152 kg) | 100% race weight, reduced reps |
| **Wall ball reps per HIIT set** | 50â€“75 | 75â€“100 | 100 (full race reps) | 50â€“75 (maintenance) |
| **BBJ distance per session** | 40 m | 60 m | 80 m (full race distance) | 40 m |
| **Strength rep ranges** | 4â€“6 reps @ 80â€“85% 1RM | 6â€“10 reps @ 70â€“80% 1RM | 8â€“12 reps @ 65â€“75% 1RM | 4â€“6 reps @ 75â€“80% 1RM (neural maintenance) |
| **HIIT time domains** | 10â€“15 min pieces | 15â€“25 min pieces | 20â€“40 min pieces | 8â€“15 min pieces |
| **Rest periods (HIIT)** | 1:1 to 1:2 work:rest | 1:0.75 to 1:1 | 1:0.5 to 1:1 | 1:1 to 1:2 |

---

**Intent:** Build aerobic base, introduce all 8 Hyrox station movements at sub-race loads, establish movement patterns and baseline benchmarks. Running dominates. Strength remains heavy but transitioning from bodybuilding to functional patterns.

| Day | Session Type | Duration | Key Focus / Intent | Example Workout |
|-----|-------------|----------|-------------------|-----------------|
| **Monday** | Easy Run (AM) + HIIT (PM) | 50 min + 45 min | Zone 2 aerobic base; introduce SkiErg/Row pacing | AM: 6 mi easy @ 8:00â€“8:30/mi. PM: HIIT #1 (Erg Pacing Builder) |
| **Tuesday** | Strength | 60 min | Lower body strength: squat and hinge patterns | Back Squat 4Ã—5 @ 80% 1RM, RDL 3Ã—8, Walking Lunge 3Ã—12/leg, Calf Raises 3Ã—15. Rest 2â€“3 min between squat sets. |
| **Wednesday** | Tempo Run | 55 min | Lactate threshold development | 2 mi warm-up â†’ 3 mi @ half-marathon pace (threshold) â†’ 2 mi cool-down. Total: 7 mi. |
| **Thursday** | HIIT (Hyrox Stations) | 50 min | Station skill development: sled + wall ball introduction | HIIT #2 (Station Introduction Circuit) |
| **Friday** | Easy Run | 45 min | Recovery-pace aerobic volume | 5.5 mi easy @ 8:30â€“9:00/mi, fully conversational |
| **Saturday** | Long Run + Strength (PM optional) | 75 min + 45 min | Aerobic endurance; upper body strength | AM: 10 mi easy @ 8:00â€“8:30/mi. PM: Bench Press 4Ã—6, Barbell Row 4Ã—8, Strict Press 3Ã—8, Pull-ups 3Ã—max. |
| **Sunday** | Rest / Active Recovery | 30 min max | Full recovery, mobility | 20 min walk + 10 min foam roll/stretch. Optional: yoga. |

**Weekly mileage: ~35.5 mi** (6 + 7 + 5.5 + 10 + 3Ã—short warm-up/cool-down mi within HIIT = ~35â€“36)

---

section: 2. Weekly Templates by Phase > 2.2 Phase 2: Specific Preparation (Weeks 5â€“7; Week 8 = Deload)
content:
**Intent:** Increase Hyrox station loads toward race weight, introduce compromised running (running immediately after station work), add a third HIIT session, begin reducing strength session volume while maintaining intensity.

| Day | Session Type | Duration | Key Focus / Intent | Example Workout |
|-----|-------------|----------|-------------------|-----------------|
| **Monday** | Easy Run (AM) + HIIT (PM) | 50 min + 50 min | Aerobic base; sled push/pull at 90% race weight | AM: 6 mi easy. PM: HIIT #5 (Sled Power Endurance) |
| **Tuesday** | Strength + Short Run | 55 min + 25 min | Lower body strength-endurance; compromised running intro | Strength: Front Squat 3Ã—8 @ 72%, DB Walking Lunge 3Ã—10/leg @ 30 kg DBs, GHD Back Extension 3Ã—12, Farmer Hold 3Ã—45 sec heavy. Then: 2.5 mi easy run immediately after (compromised). |
| **Wednesday** | Interval Run | 60 min | VOâ‚‚max development (Norwegian 4Ã—4) | 2 mi warm-up â†’ 4Ã—4 min @ 90% HRmax w/ 3 min jog recovery â†’ 2 mi cool-down. Total: ~8 mi. |
| **Thursday** | HIIT (Hyrox Full-Body) | 55 min | Wall balls, BBJ, lunges at increasing loads | HIIT #8 (The Grinder: BBJ + Wall Ball + Lunge Chipper) |
| **Friday** | Easy Run | 45 min | Recovery volume | 5.5 mi easy @ 8:15â€“8:45/mi |
| **Saturday** | Long Run (AM) + HIIT (PM) | 80 min + 45 min | Endurance + station practice under fatigue | AM: 11 mi easy (last 2 mi at tempo). PM: HIIT #10 (Compromised Running Circuit) |
| **Sunday** | Rest / Active Recovery | 30 min | Full recovery | Walk, foam roll, light mobility |

**Weekly mileage: ~38.5 mi** (6 + 2.5 + 8 + 5.5 + 11 + ~5.5 from HIIT run components)

---

section: 2. Weekly Templates by Phase > 2.3 Phase 3: Competition Preparation (Weeks 9â€“11; Week 12 = Deload)
content:
**Intent:** Race-weight stations, full-distance station work, race-pace simulation sessions, pacing refinement, mental toughness development. Running volume holds steady but intensity of HIIT peaks. One strength session drops to maintenance-only.

| Day | Session Type | Duration | Key Focus / Intent | Example Workout |
|-----|-------------|----------|-------------------|-----------------|
| **Monday** | Easy Run (AM) + HIIT (PM) | 50 min + 55 min | Aerobic base; race-weight sled + erg intervals | AM: 6 mi easy. PM: HIIT #12 (Race Pace Station Intervals) |
| **Tuesday** | Strength (Maintenance) | 50 min | Lower body neural maintenance; heavy but low volume | Back Squat 3Ã—4 @ 82%, Deadlift 3Ã—3 @ 85%, Single-Leg RDL 2Ã—8/leg, Hanging Knee Raise 3Ã—12. Rest 3 min between compound sets. |
| **Wednesday** | Tempo/Threshold Run | 60 min | Race-pace running with negative split practice | 2 mi warm-up â†’ 4 mi at goal Hyrox run pace (4:30â€“4:45/km) â†’ 1 mi at 10 sec/km faster â†’ 1 mi cool-down. Total: ~8 mi. |
| **Thursday** | HIIT (Hyrox Race-Specific) | 60 min | Full-distance stations under fatigue, compromised running | HIIT #14 (4-Station Hyrox Block) |
| **Friday** | Easy Run | 40 min | Recovery | 5 mi easy |
| **Saturday** | HIIT/Simulation (AM) + Short Run (PM) | 70 min + 25 min | Hyrox simulation (full or partial); benchmark tracking | Full Sim #2 or HIIT #16 (depending on week). PM: 3 mi easy shakeout. |
| **Sunday** | Rest / Active Recovery | 30 min | Full recovery | Walk, stretch, mental visualization |

**Weekly mileage: ~37 mi** (6 + 8 + 5 + 3 + ~15 from within HIIT/sim sessions)

---

section: 2. Weekly Templates by Phase > 2.4 Phase 4: Taper & Peak (Weeks 13â€“16)
content:
**Intent:** Volume drops 20â€“30%. Intensity maintained on key sessions. Sharpen race execution, practice pacing, build confidence, arrive race day fresh and fast.

#### Weeks 13â€“14 Template

| Day | Session Type | Duration | Key Focus / Intent | Example Workout |
|-----|-------------|----------|-------------------|-----------------|
| **Monday** | Easy Run + HIIT (PM) | 45 min + 40 min | Maintain aerobic base; short, sharp HIIT | AM: 5 mi easy. PM: HIIT #17 (Taper Sharpener â€” 15-min EMOM with reduced volume) |
| **Tuesday** | Strength (Light Maintenance) | 40 min | Neural activation, not fatigue | Back Squat 2Ã—4 @ 78%, RDL 2Ã—6 @ 70%, Pull-ups 2Ã—8, Plank 2Ã—45 sec. |
| **Wednesday** | Interval Run (Reduced) | 50 min | VOâ‚‚max maintenance at reduced volume | 2 mi warm-up â†’ 3Ã—4 min @ 90% HRmax w/ 3 min jog â†’ 2 mi cool-down. Total: ~7 mi. |
| **Thursday** | HIIT (Race-Pace Touchpoint) or Dress Rehearsal (Wk 14) | 45â€“60 min | Race-pace stations at reduced volume; OR Half-Simulation | Wk 13: HIIT #19 (Race-Pace Express). Wk 14: Simulation #5 (Dress Rehearsal). |
| **Friday** | Easy Run | 35 min | Legs-up recovery jog | 4 mi easy |
| **Saturday** | Easy Run | 50 min | Long(er) easy effort, last before final taper | 6 mi easy |
| **Sunday** | Rest | â€” | Full rest | â€” |

**Weekly mileage: ~30 mi**

#### Week 15 Template

| Day | Session Type | Duration | Key Focus / Intent | Example Workout |
|-----|-------------|----------|-------------------|-----------------|
| **Monday** | Easy Run | 40 min | Aerobic maintenance | 5 mi easy |
| **Tuesday** | HIIT (Short & Sharp) | 30 min | Race-pace touch â€” reduced volume, high quality | HIIT #20 (Race Primer â€” 10-min EMOM, race-weight stations, 50% volume) |
| **Wednesday** | Easy Run + 4Ã—Strides | 35 min | Neuromuscular activation | 4 mi easy + 4Ã—100m strides @ mile pace w/ walk-back |
| **Thursday** | Rest or Light Walk | 20 min | Recovery | 20-min walk + mobility |
| **Friday** | Easy Run | 30 min | Shakeout | 3.5 mi easy |
| **Saturday** | Rest | â€” | Full rest | â€” |
| **Sunday** | Rest or Light Walk | 20 min | Pre-race week transition | Walk + visualization |

**Weekly mileage: ~15.5 mi**

#### Week 16 â€” Race Week

| Day | Session Type | Duration | Key Focus / Intent | Example Workout |
|-----|-------------|----------|-------------------|-----------------|
| **Monday** (Jun 2) | Easy Run + Strides | 30 min | Last real workout before race | 3 mi easy + 4Ã—80m strides. Gentle. Controlled. |
| **Tuesday** (Jun 3) | Rest or 15-min Walk | 15 min | Full recovery | Optional: 15 min walk + light stretching. |
| **Wednesday** (Jun 4) | Shakeout Run | 20 min | Neural priming, confidence builder | 2 mi easy with 2Ã—30-sec race-pace pickups. |
| **Thursday** (Jun 5) | Rest | â€” | Pre-race rest, gear prep, mental visualization | Pack race bag, write pacing targets on arm, prep nutrition (gels, electrolytes). |
| **Friday** (Jun 6) | **RACE DAY** | ~70â€“90 min | Execute race plan | Full warm-up protocol (see Section 6). |
| **Saturday** (Jun 7) | Active Recovery | 20 min | Post-race recovery | Walk, light stretching, high-carb + protein meal. |
| **Sunday** (Jun 8) | Rest | â€” | Full rest | â€” |

---

section: 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #1 â€” Erg Pacing Builder (Phase 1) + 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #2 â€” Station Introduction Circuit (Phase 1)
content:
**Format:** Alternating EMOM  
**Duration:** 20 minutes (20 rounds)  
**Target:** SkiErg + Row pacing discipline; aerobic capacity  
**Equipment:** SkiErg, Concept2 RowErg

| Minute | Movement | Prescription | Target |
|--------|----------|-------------|--------|
| Odd minutes (1,3,5â€¦) | SkiErg | 15 calories | Complete in ~40 sec, rest remainder |
| Even minutes (2,4,6â€¦) | Row | 15 calories | Complete in ~42 sec, rest remainder |

**Intensity:** RPE 6â€“7. Aim for identical split each round (Â±1 sec). If you finish with <12 sec rest, reduce to 12 cal.  
**Scaling:** Reduce to 12 cal per round (beginner) or increase to 18 cal (advanced).  
**Target Score:** Total calories should be 300 (15Ã—20). Track deviation from target split each round.

---

**Format:** 4 Rounds For Quality (not for time)  
**Duration:** 40â€“45 minutes  
**Target:** Movement skill acquisition for all 8 Hyrox stations at sub-race loads

| Round | Movement | Prescription | Notes |
|-------|----------|-------------|-------|
| A | SkiErg | 250 m @ controlled pace | Focus on lat engagement, hip hinge |
| B | Sled Push | 2 Ã— 12.5 m @ 80% race weight (122 kg) | Practice 45Â° body angle, short steps |
| C | Sled Pull | 2 Ã— 12.5 m @ 80% race weight (82 kg) | Practice hip extension technique |
| D | Burpee Broad Jump | 20 m | Step-up method, consistent jump distance |
| E | Row | 250 m @ controlled pace | 24â€“26 spm, legs-back-arms sequence |
| F | Farmers Carry | 50 m @ 2Ã—24 kg | Tall posture, brisk walk |
| G | Sandbag Lunges | 25 m @ 20 kg | 0.9â€“1.0 m step length, touch-and-go |
| H | Wall Balls | 25 reps @ 6 kg to 10 ft | Full squat depth, catch-and-squat rhythm |

**Rest:** 60â€“90 sec between stations. Walk to next station = transition practice.  
**Scaling:** Reduce loads by 20% or cut distances/reps in half for beginners. Advanced: race weight on everything, reduce rest to 30 sec.

---

section: 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #3 â€” Norwegian 4Ã—4 on the Rower (Phase 1) + 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #4 â€” Wall Ball Endurance Builder (Phase 1)
content:
**Format:** Interval  
**Duration:** 30 minutes  
**Target:** VOâ‚‚max development, rowing pacing discipline

| Set | Prescription | Intensity | Rest |
|-----|-------------|-----------|------|
| Warm-up | 5 min easy row @ 2:15â€“2:30/500m | Zone 2 | â€” |
| Interval 1 | 4 min row @ 85â€“90% HRmax (target 1:50â€“1:55/500m) | Zone 4â€“5 | 3 min easy row |
| Interval 2 | 4 min row | Same | 3 min easy row |
| Interval 3 | 4 min row | Same | 3 min easy row |
| Interval 4 | 4 min row | Same | â€” |
| Cool-down | 3 min easy row | Zone 1 | â€” |

**Target Score:** Total meters rowed during the 4 work intervals. Track each 4-min distance individually â€” variance >30m between intervals = pacing failure.  
**Scaling:** Reduce to 3Ã—4 min if RPE exceeds 9/10 on interval 3. Advanced: add 5th interval.

---

**Format:** EMOM 16  
**Duration:** 16 minutes  
**Target:** Muscular endurance for wall balls; pacing across high-rep sets

| Minute | Movement | Prescription |
|--------|----------|-------------|
| Min 1â€“4 | Wall Balls | 15 reps @ 6 kg to 10 ft target |
| Min 5â€“8 | Air Squat | 15 reps (tempo: 2-sec down, explosive up) |
| Min 9â€“12 | Wall Balls | 15 reps @ 6 kg |
| Min 13â€“16 | Wall Balls | 12 reps @ 6 kg |

**Rest:** Remainder of each minute. Target: complete wall balls in 35â€“45 sec per set, leaving 15â€“25 sec rest.  
**Intensity:** RPE 7 by round 12. If RPE > 8 by round 8, reduce to 12 reps per set.  
**Total reps:** 162 wall balls + 60 air squats.  
**Scaling:** Reduce to 10 wall balls per set (beginner). Advanced: 20 reps per set or use 9 kg ball.

---

section: 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #5 â€” Sled Power Endurance (Phase 2)
content:
**Format:** Every 3:00 Ã— 8 Sets  
**Duration:** 24 minutes  
**Target:** Sled push/pull at race or near-race weight; sustained output with controlled rest

| Set | Movement | Prescription | Notes |
|-----|----------|-------------|-------|
| 1 | Sled Push | 4 Ã— 12.5 m (50m) @ 137 kg (90% race weight) | Continuous â€” never let sled stop |
| 2 | Sled Pull | 4 Ã— 12.5 m (50m) @ 93 kg (90% race weight) | Hip extension method, rapid hand-over-hand |
| 3 | Sled Push | 50m @ 137 kg | Same cues |
| 4 | Sled Pull | 50m @ 93 kg | Same cues |
| 5 | Sled Push | 50m @ 137 kg | Push pace â€” aim to beat Set 1 time |
| 6 | Sled Pull | 50m @ 93 kg | Same |
| 7 | Sled Push | 50m @ 137 kg | â€” |
| 8 | Sled Pull | 50m @ 93 kg | â€” |

**Rest:** Remaining time in the 3:00 window. Aim for 90â€“120 sec work per set, leaving 60â€“90 sec rest.  
**Intensity:** RPE 7â€“8. Track split times for each 50m â€” variance >10 sec across sets = poor pacing.  
**Scaling:** Reduce to 80% race weight (122 kg push / 82 kg pull) if failing to complete in <2:00. Advanced: 100% race weight (152 kg / 103 kg).

---

section: 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #6 â€” Burpee Broad Jump + Run Coupling (Phase 2) + 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #7 â€” Farmers Carry + Lunges Superset (Phase 2)
content:
**Format:** 5 Rounds For Time  
**Duration:** 20â€“28 minutes (time cap: 30 min)  
**Target:** BBJ pacing, compromised running

| Round | Movement | Prescription |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| Each round | Burpee Broad Jump | 16 m (step-up method, ~10â€“12 reps) |
| Then | Run | 400 m @ goal Hyrox run pace (4:30â€“4:45/km = ~1:48â€“1:54 per 400m) |

**Rest:** None between movements. Walk 30 sec between rounds only if RPE â‰¥ 9.  
**Intensity:** RPE 7â€“8. BBJ should take ~60â€“75 sec per 16m. Run pacing is critical â€” use GPS watch.  
**Target time:** 22â€“26 min total. Track BBJ time and 400m split separately each round.  
**Scaling:** Reduce BBJ to 12 m (beginner). Advanced: 20 m per round + 600 m runs.

---

**Format:** 4 Rounds, Every 5:00  
**Duration:** 20 minutes  
**Target:** Grip endurance, lunge efficiency, postural integrity under load

| Round | Movement A | Movement B | Prescription |
|-------|-----------|-----------|-------------|
| Each round | Farmers Carry | 100 m @ 2Ã—24 kg | Fast walk, 0 planned stops |
| Then | Sandbag Lunges | 25 m @ 20 kg | 0.9â€“1.0 m steps, touch-and-go |

**Rest:** Remaining time in the 5:00 window. Target: complete both movements in 2:30â€“3:30, leaving 1:30â€“2:30 rest.  
**Intensity:** RPE 7. Focus on grip management â€” chalk hands before round 1.  
**Scaling:** 2Ã—16 kg carries + 10 kg sandbag (beginner). Advanced: 2Ã—32 kg + 30 kg sandbag.

---

section: 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #8 â€” The Grinder: BBJ + Wall Ball + Lunge Chipper (Phase 2) + 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #9 â€” SkiErg + Sled Pull EMOM (Phase 2)
content:
**Format:** For Time (Chipper)  
**Duration:** 25â€“35 minutes (time cap: 38 min)  
**Target:** Full-body Hyrox station stamina; pacing across multiple fatiguing stations

| Order | Movement | Prescription |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| 1 | Burpee Broad Jumps | 60 m |
| 2 | Wall Balls | 75 reps @ 6 kg to 10 ft |
| 3 | Sandbag Lunges | 75 m @ 20 kg |
| 4 | Wall Balls | 25 reps @ 6 kg |
| 5 | Burpee Broad Jumps | 20 m |

**Rest:** Self-regulated. Planned micro-breaks only (3â€“5 sec).  
**Intensity:** RPE 8. Wall ball break strategy: 25-25-25 on the first set of 75. Lunges: continuous.  
**Target time:** Sub-30 min.  
**Scaling:** Reduce BBJ to 40 m + 50 WB + 50 m lunges + 15 WB + 10 m BBJ. Advanced: all distances/reps at full race spec + add 200 m run between each movement.

---

**Format:** EMOM 20  
**Duration:** 20 minutes  
**Target:** Upper body pulling endurance, aerobic capacity

| Minute | Movement | Prescription |
|--------|----------|-------------|
| Min 1 | SkiErg | 18 cal |
| Min 2 | Sled Pull | 1 Ã— 12.5 m @ 90% race weight |
| Min 3 | SkiErg | 18 cal |
| Min 4 | Rest | Active: walk, shake arms |
| Repeat 5 rounds |||

**Intensity:** RPE 7. SkiErg split: 1:50â€“2:00/500m. Sled pull: complete in <30 sec per 12.5m.  
**Scaling:** 14 cal SkiErg, 80% sled weight (beginner). Advanced: 22 cal SkiErg, 100% sled weight, remove rest minute (EMOM 15: 3 movements per 5-min block).

---

section: 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #10 â€” Compromised Running Circuit (Phase 2) + 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #11 â€” Tabata Station Blitz (Phase 2/3)
content:
**Format:** 4 Rounds For Time  
**Duration:** 30â€“40 minutes (time cap: 42 min)  
**Target:** Running under fatigue â€” the defining Hyrox skill

| Round | Segment | Prescription |
|-------|---------|-------------|
| A | Sled Push | 50 m @ 90% race weight |
| B | Run | 1 km @ goal Hyrox pace |
| C | Row | 500 m @ 1:55â€“2:05/500m |
| D | Run | 1 km @ goal Hyrox pace |

**Rest:** None between segments. 60 sec between rounds (walk, sip water).  
**Intensity:** RPE 8. The runs are the focus â€” track every 1 km split.  
**Target time:** 32â€“36 min. Run splits should be within 10 sec of each other.  
**Scaling:** Remove 1 round (3 rounds total) or reduce sled to 80% and row to 400m. Advanced: add BBJ 20m after the sled push.

---

**Format:** Tabata (20 sec on / 10 sec off Ã— 8 rounds per station, 1 min between stations)  
**Duration:** 24 minutes  
**Target:** Anaerobic capacity across multiple movement patterns

| Station (4 min each) | Movement | Prescription |
|----------------------|----------|-------------|
| Station A | Wall Balls | 20 sec max reps @ 6 kg â†’ 10 sec rest Ã— 8 rounds |
| 1 min rest |||
| Station B | Burpee Broad Jump | 20 sec max distance â†’ 10 sec rest Ã— 8 |
| 1 min rest |||
| Station C | SkiErg | 20 sec max cal â†’ 10 sec rest Ã— 8 |
| 1 min rest |||
| Station D | Sandbag Lunges | 20 sec max distance @ 20 kg â†’ 10 sec rest Ã— 8 |

**Score:** Total reps (WB), total distance (BBJ + lunges), total calories (SkiErg).  
**Intensity:** RPE 9â€“10 during work intervals. Full send.  
**Scaling:** 4 kg wall ball, no sandbag on lunges (beginner). Advanced: 9 kg wall ball, 30 kg sandbag.

---

section: 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #12 â€” Race Pace Station Intervals (Phase 3) + 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #13 â€” Wall Ball Century (Phase 3)
content:
**Format:** Every 4:00 Ã— 8 Sets  
**Duration:** 32 minutes  
**Target:** Each station practiced at race-weight, race-pace conditions with timed recovery

| Set | Station | Prescription | Target Time |
|-----|---------|-------------|-------------|
| 1 | SkiErg 500 m | Race pace: 1:50â€“1:55/500m | ~1:55 |
| 2 | Sled Push 50 m | 100% race weight (152 kg) | <3:00 |
| 3 | Sled Pull 50 m | 100% race weight (103 kg) | <3:30 |
| 4 | BBJ 40 m | Step-up, consistent tempo | <2:30 |
| 5 | Row 500 m | Race pace: 1:50â€“1:55/500m | ~1:55 |
| 6 | Farmers Carry 100 m | 2Ã—24 kg, fast walk | <1:15 |
| 7 | Sandbag Lunges 50 m | 20 kg, 0.9 m steps | <2:30 |
| 8 | Wall Balls 50 reps | 6 kg to 10 ft, sets of 25 | <3:00 |

**Rest:** Remaining time in the 4:00 window.  
**Intensity:** RPE 7â€“8. The goal is consistency and pacing, not redlining.  
**Scoring:** Sum of all 8 station times. Compare week-over-week.  
**Scaling:** 50% distances/reps per station (beginner). Advanced: 4-min windows â†’ 3:30 windows.

---

**Format:** For Time  
**Duration:** 8â€“14 minutes  
**Target:** Full 100-rep wall ball performance with race-day break strategy

| Segment | Prescription |
|---------|-------------|
| Set 1 | 25 Wall Balls @ 6 kg to 10 ft |
| Rest | 5 sec (ball down, shake arms, 3 breaths) |
| Set 2 | 25 Wall Balls |
| Rest | 5 sec |
| Set 3 | 25 Wall Balls |
| Rest | 5 sec |
| Set 4 | 25 Wall Balls |

**Intensity:** RPE 8â€“9. Cadence: one rep every 3 sec. Total target: 5:30â€“6:30.  
**Key coaching cue:** If any set takes >100 sec, you started too fast. The 4Ã—25 pattern trains the exact break strategy to use on race day.  
**Scaling:** 4Ã—15 (60 total, beginner). Advanced: 50-25-25 or unbroken attempt.

---

section: 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #14 â€” 4-Station Hyrox Block (Phase 3) + 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #15 â€” Sled + Row Superset (Phase 3)
content:

**Rest:** None. Treat Roxzone transitions as race-pace jogs (target <45 sec per transition).

| Round | Movement A | Movement B |
|-------|-----------|-----------|
| Each round | Sled Push: 50 m @ 152 kg (race weight) | Row: 250 m @ 1:55â€“2:00/500m |

**Rest:** Remaining time in 5:00 window. Target: sled in ~2:30â€“3:00, row in ~55 sec. Total work ~3:30â€“4:00, rest ~60â€“90 sec.  
**Intensity:** RPE 8. Focus on sled technique: 45Â° angle, short steps, never stop.

section: 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #16 â€” Stations 1â€“4 Block Simulation (Phase 3) + 3. HIIT Session Library (20 Workouts) > HIIT #17 â€” Taper Sharpener EMOM (Phase 4)
content:
**Format:** For Time  
**Duration:** 30â€“42 minutes (time cap: 45 min)  
**Target:** Race-specific first-half simulation

| Segment | Prescription |
|---------|-------------|
| Run | 1 km @ goal pace |

section: 5. Progressive Overload Strategy > 5.1 Running Progression + 5. Progressive Overload Strategy > 5.2 Station-Specific Progression
content:
| Variable | Phase 1 (Wk 1â€“4) | Phase 2 (Wk 5â€“8) | Phase 3 (Wk 9â€“12) | Phase 4 (Wk 13â€“16) |
|----------|------------------|------------------|-------------------|---------------------|
| Weekly mileage | 35â€“38 mi | 36â€“40 mi | 35â€“38 mi | 28â€“15 mi (â†“) |
| Long run distance | 10 mi | 11 mi | 10 mi | 8 â†’ 6 â†’ 0 mi |
| Tempo run distance | 3 mi @ threshold | 3â€“4 mi @ threshold | 4 mi @ race pace | 2 mi @ race pace |
| VOâ‚‚max intervals | 4Ã—4 min | 4Ã—4 min | 5Ã—4 min or 6Ã—3 min | 3Ã—4 min â†’ 0 |
| Compromised runs | 0 | 1/week (2.5 mi post-strength) | 2/week (within HIIT sessions) | 1/week (within reduced HIIT) |
| Easy run pace | 8:00â€“8:30/mi | 8:00â€“8:30/mi | 8:00â€“8:30/mi | 8:00â€“8:30/mi |
| Goal race pace target | 7:15â€“7:30/mi (4:30â€“4:40/km) | 7:05â€“7:20/mi (4:25â€“4:35/km) | 7:00â€“7:15/mi (4:20â€“4:30/km) | Maintain Phase 3 pace |

**Progression logic:** Mileage builds 5â€“8% per 3-week block then drops 20â€“25% on deload week. Intensity (tempo/interval pace) improves as aerobic base adapts. Compromised running is added in Phase 2 and increased in Phase 3 because the ability to run well under station fatigue is the single most trainable Hyrox limiter.

| Station | Phase 1 Load/Volume | Phase 2 | Phase 3 | Phase 4 |
|---------|-------------------|---------|---------|---------|
| **Sled Push** | 122 kg (80%), 2Ã—50m per session | 137 kg (90%), 4Ã—50m | 152 kg (100%), 4Ã—50m | 152 kg, 2Ã—50m (reduced vol) |
| **Sled Pull** | 82 kg (80%), 2Ã—50m | 93 kg (90%), 4Ã—50m | 103 kg (100%), 4Ã—50m | 103 kg, 2Ã—50m |
| **Wall Balls** | 6 kg, sets of 15â€“25, total 75/session | 6 kg, sets of 25, total 100/session | 6 kg, 4Ã—25 or unbroken 100 | 6 kg, 50 reps max |
| **BBJ** | 20â€“40 m per session | 40â€“60 m | 80 m (full race distance) | 40 m |
| **Lunges** | 20 kg, 25â€“50 m per session | 20 kg, 50â€“75 m | 20 kg, 100 m (full race distance) | 20 kg, 50 m |
| **Farmers Carry** | 2Ã—24 kg, 50â€“100 m | 2Ã—24 kg, 100â€“150 m | 2Ã—24 kg, 200 m (full race distance) | 2Ã—24 kg, 100 m |
| **SkiErg** | 500 m intervals | 750 m intervals | 1,000 m (full race distance) | 500 m (maintenance) |
| **Row** | 500 m intervals | 750 m intervals | 1,000 m (full race distance) | 500 m |

**Progression logic:** Load increases linearly from 80% â†’ 90% â†’ 100% race weight across Phases 1â€“3. Volume increases alongside load (more sets, longer distances) until Phase 3 reaches full race specifications. Phase 4 maintains race-weight loads but cuts volume by ~50% to preserve freshness.

section: 5. Progressive Overload Strategy > 5.3 Strength Progression + 5. Progressive Overload Strategy > 5.4 HIIT Complexity & Density Progression
content:
| Phase | Squat Protocol | Deadlift Protocol | Accessory Focus | Sessions/Week |
|-------|---------------|-------------------|-----------------|---------------|
| Phase 1 | Back Squat 4Ã—5 @ 80% â†’ 4Ã—4 @ 83% â†’ 4Ã—3 @ 85% | Deadlift 3Ã—5 @ 78% â†’ 3Ã—4 @ 82% | Pull-ups, rows, RDL, walking lunges | 2 |
| Phase 2 | Front Squat 3Ã—8 @ 72% â†’ 3Ã—6 @ 75% | RDL 3Ã—8 @ 70% | DB lunges, GHD, farmer holds | 2 |
| Phase 3 | Back Squat 3Ã—4 @ 82% (maintenance) | Deadlift 3Ã—3 @ 85% (maintenance) | Single-leg work, core stability | 1â€“2 |
| Phase 4 | Back Squat 2Ã—4 @ 78% (activation) | Deadlift 2Ã—3 @ 75% (light) | Minimal â€” pull-ups 2Ã—8, plank 2Ã—45s | 1 |

**Progression logic:** Phase 1 follows classic 5-3-1 progression building toward high relative intensity. Phase 2 shifts to hypertrophy/strength-endurance rep ranges (6â€“10 reps) to support station demands. Phase 3 reverts to low-rep, moderate-load maintenance â€” the goal is to preserve strength without accumulating fatigue. Phase 4 is activation only.

| Variable | Phase 1 | Phase 2 | Phase 3 | Phase 4 |
|----------|---------|---------|---------|---------|
| Sessions/week | 2 | 3 | 3 | 2 â†’ 1 |
| Avg session duration | 35â€“45 min | 45â€“55 min | 50â€“65 min | 30â€“40 min |
| Time domains | 10â€“20 min pieces | 15â€“25 min pieces | 20â€“40 min pieces | 10â€“15 min pieces |
| Work:rest ratios | 1:1 to 1:2 | 1:0.75 to 1:1 | 1:0.5 to 1:1 | 1:1 to 1:2 |
| Station load | 80% race weight | 90% race weight | 100% race weight | 100% load, 50% volume |
| Movements per session | 2â€“4 stations | 3â€“6 stations | 4â€“8 stations (full race) | 2â€“4 stations |
| Compromised running included | No | Yes (1/session) | Yes (2â€“4 km per session) | Yes (1â€“2 km) |

section: 6. Taper Protocol > 6.1 Final 14-Day Taper Strategy (Weeks 15â€“16)
content:
The taper follows the evidence-based model: **reduce volume 40â€“60%** while **maintaining or slightly increasing intensity** on key sessions. This preserves neuromuscular readiness and aerobic fitness while allowing full glycogen resynthesis, muscle repair, and psychological freshness.

| Day (countdown) | Date | Session | Volume vs. Peak | Intensity | Notes |
|-----------------|------|---------|----------------|-----------|-------|
| Day -14 | May 23 (Fri) | Easy Run 5 mi | 60% | Zone 2 | Last "normal" easy run |
| Day -13 | May 24 (Sat) | HIIT #17 (Taper Sharpener) | 50% | RPE 7 | Reduced-volume EMOM, race-weight touch |
| Day -12 | May 25 (Sun) | Rest | 0% | â€” | Full rest |
| Day -11 | May 26 (Mon) | Easy Run 5 mi + Strides | 55% | Zone 2 + 4Ã—100m strides | Neuromuscular activation |
| Day -10 | May 27 (Tue) | Strength (Light) 40 min | 40% | RPE 5â€“6 | 2Ã—4 squat @ 78%, 2Ã—6 RDL, 2Ã—8 pull-ups |
| Day -9 | May 28 (Wed) | Interval Run (Reduced) | 50% | 3Ã—4 min @ 90% HRmax | Last real VOâ‚‚max session |
| Day -8 | May 29 (Thu) | Rest or 20 min walk | 0% | â€” | Mental prep begins |
| Day -7 | May 30 (Fri) | Easy Run 4 mi | 40% | Zone 2 | Gentle shakeout |
| Day -6 | May 31 (Sat) | HIIT #20 (Race Primer EMOM) 10 min | 25% | RPE 5â€“6 | Neural priming only â€” race-weight stations at 50% volume |
| Day -5 | Jun 1 (Sun) | Rest | 0% | â€” | Full rest |
| Day -4 | Jun 2 (Mon) | Easy Run 3 mi + 4Ã—80m strides | 30% | Zone 2 + strides at mile pace | Last real workout |
| Day -3 | Jun 3 (Tue) | Rest / 15-min walk | 0% | â€” | Optional light walk |
| Day -2 | Jun 4 (Wed) | Shakeout 2 mi + 2Ã—30-sec pickups | 20% | Easy + 2 race-pace bursts | Neural priming, confidence builder |
| Day -1 | Jun 5 (Thu) | Rest | 0% | â€” | Gear prep, hydrate, carb-load, visualize |
| **Race Day** | Jun 6 (Fri) | **HYROX** | 100% | Race effort | Execute the plan |

content:

| 7: Assembly | T-5 min | â€” | Enter Start Zone. Put on timing chip. Confirm wave number matches arm marking. Controlled breathing. |
